function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Individuals continuously assess their protection status based on the adult mosquito population size and the prevalence of infected humans.","Impact":"Uninformed decisions regarding protection status may lead to increased risk of mosquito-borne disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Education and awareness campaigns to inform individuals about the factors affecting protection status and the importance of consistent personal protection.","Technologies":"Communication technologies for disseminating information to the public.","People":"General public, individuals at risk of mosquito-borne diseases.","Owner":"Public health organizations, government authorities."},{"Description":"Aggregate average public demand for local-level vector control by authorities is dictated by the infected human population.","Impact":"Inadequate vector control measures in response to fluctuating infected human population size may result in increased mosquito-borne disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Developing adaptive response strategies for vector control that consider the fluctuating demand based on infected human population size.","Technologies":"Data analytics and modeling for predicting and adapting to changes in demand for vector control measures.","People":"Public health authorities, local government, affected communities.","Owner":"Public health organizations, local government."},{"Description":"The modified Ross-Macdonald model reflects the specific case of Zika virus in Aedes aegypti mosquitos.","Impact":"Limited applicability of the model to other vector-borne diseases and mosquito species.","Mitigation":"Research and development of generalized models that can be adapted to different vector-borne diseases and mosquito species.","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis for identifying common patterns across vector-borne diseases, modeling techniques for generalizing disease spread dynamics.","People":"Public health researchers, epidemiologists, modeling experts.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."}]}
